query:
The \_\_\_\_\_ ratio compares the length of the adjacent leg to the length of the hypotenuse 
\begin{align*}
\text{A)}\ & sine &
\text{B)}\ & cosine  \\
\text{C)}\ & tangent  &
\text{D)}\ & \text{none of the above}\\
\end{align*}
answers_list:
[reasoning process] To solve the question, we need to recall the definitions of the trigonometric ratios in relation to a right triangle. There are three primary ratios:

- Sine (sin) is defined as the ratio of the length of the opposite leg to the length of the hypotenuse.
- Cosine (cos) is defined as the ratio of the length of the adjacent leg to the length of the hypotenuse.
- Tangent (tan) is defined as the ratio of the length of the opposite leg to the length of the adjacent leg.

Since the question specifically asks for the ratio that compares the length of the adjacent leg to the length of the hypotenuse, we find that this is the definition of cosine.

[Verification] The answer options provided include sine, cosine, tangent, and none of the above. As established, the cosine ratio perfectly matches the criteria mentioned in the question.

[Final Answer] The answer is \\boxed{B} \n#### B
